## GAD-7 vs RAPI

GAD-7 vs RAPI: A Comparative Analysis The process of comparing psychological instruments like Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Rutgers Alcohol Problem Index (RAPI) can be an extremely intricate and time-consuming process. Harmonisation plays a crucial role in drawing conclusions and comparisons across diverse study results. However, due to its manual nature, it can be subjected to varied interpretations. Presenting you Harmony, a tool that simplifies this process by automating the harmonisation procedure. Harmony is designed to make the comparison between instruments such as GAD-7 and RAPI less cumbersome. For instance, if a researcher wants to contrast GAD-7 vs RAPI, Harmony can provide a percentage match for each item. This allows for a more efficient and objective analysis. Harmony uses AI and Natural Language Processing to match and analyse the items in different questionnaires. This leads to a more accurate and unbiased comparison in GAD-7 vs RAPI, saving valuable time and effort for the researching psychologist. Allow the power of AI to assist you in your research. Drag and drop questionnaires right into Harmony's easy-to-use web interface and wait for your results. Harmony's system can handle instruments in multiple languages and can make a significant contribution to your research process. If you aim to compare GAD-7 vs RAPI or any other psychological instruments, consider using Harmony to make your process faster, efficient, and more reliable.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and RAPI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and RAPI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RAPI into Harmony</a> - compare RAPI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
